field_map.description:
Maps the document field names to the known field names of the model.
This mapping takes precedence over any default mappings provided in the model configuration.

num_top_feature_importance_values.description: Specifies the maximum number of feature importance values per document.

num_top_classes.description: Specifies the number of top class predictions to return.

num_top_feature_importance_values.description: Specifies the maximum number of feature importance values per document.

prediction_field_type.description:
Specifies the type of the predicted field to write.
Valid values are: `string`, `number`, `boolean`.

_routing.description: Value used to send the document to a specific primary shard.

_spec_utils:StringifiedVersionNumber.description:
Some APIs will return values such as numbers also as a string (notably epoch timestamps). This behavior
is used to capture this behavior while keeping the semantics of the field type.

Depending on the target language, code generators can keep the union or remove it and leniently parse
strings to the target type.

explain.description: If `true`, returns detailed information about score calculation as part of each hit.

params.description:
Key-value pairs used to replace Mustache variables in the template.
The key is the variable name.
The value is the variable value.

profile.description: If `true`, the query execution is profiled.

source.description:
An inline search template. Supports the same parameters as the search API's
request body. Also supports Mustache variables. If no id is specified, this
parameter is required.

doc.description: An artificial document (a document not present in the index) for which you want to retrieve term vectors.

field_statistics.description: If `true`, the response includes the document count, sum of document frequencies, and sum of total term frequencies.

offsets.description: If `true`, the response includes term offsets.

payloads.description: If `true`, the response includes term payloads.

positions.description: If `true`, the response includes term positions.

term_statistics.description: If true, the response includes term frequency and document frequency.

max_doc_freq.description:
Ignore words which occur in more than this many docs.
Defaults to unbounded.

max_num_terms.description: Maximum number of terms that must be returned per field.

max_term_freq.description:
Ignore words with more than this frequency in the source doc.
Defaults to unbounded.

max_word_length.description:
The maximum word length above which words will be ignored.
Defaults to unbounded.

min_doc_freq.description: Ignore terms which do not occur in at least this many docs.

min_term_freq.description: Ignore words with less than this frequency in the source doc.

min_word_length.description: The minimum word length below which words will be ignored.

build_hash.description: Short hash of the last git commit in this release.

total_indexing_buffer.description: Total heap allowed to be used to hold recently indexed documents before they must be written to disk. This size is a shared pool across all shards on this node, and is controlled by Indexing Buffer settings.

arch.description: Name of the JVM architecture (ex: amd64, x86)

available_processors.description: Number of processors available to the Java virtual machine

allocated_processors.description: The number of processors actually used to calculate thread pool size. This number can be set with the node.processors setting of a node and defaults to the number of processors reported by the OS.

mlockall.description: Indicates if the process address space has been successfully locked in memory

breakers.description: Statistics about the field data circuit breaker.

ip.description: IP address and port for the node.

thread_pool.description: Statistics about each thread pool, including current size, queue and rejected tasks.

attributes.description: Contains a list of attributes for the node.

avg_queue_size.description: The exponentially weighted moving average queue size of search requests on the keyed node.

avg_response_time_ns.description: The exponentially weighted moving average response time, in nanoseconds, of search requests on the keyed node.

avg_service_time_ns.description: The exponentially weighted moving average service time, in nanoseconds, of search requests on the keyed node.

outgoing_searches.description: The number of outstanding search requests to the keyed node from the node these stats are for.

rank.description: The rank of this node; used for shard selection when routing search requests.

estimated_size.description: Estimated memory used for the operation.

estimated_size_in_bytes.description: Estimated memory used, in bytes, for the operation.

limit_size.description: Memory limit for the circuit breaker.

limit_size_in_bytes.description: Memory limit, in bytes, for the circuit breaker.

overhead.description: A constant that all estimates for the circuit breaker are multiplied with to calculate a final estimate.

tripped.description: Total number of times the circuit breaker has been triggered and prevented an out of memory error.

timestamp.description:
Last time the file stores statistics were refreshed.
Recorded in milliseconds since the Unix Epoch.

available.description: Total amount of disk space available to this Java virtual machine on this file store.

available_in_bytes.description: Total number of bytes available to this Java virtual machine on this file store.

free.description: Total amount of unallocated disk space in the file store.

free_in_bytes.description: Total number of unallocated bytes in the file store.

mount.description: Mount point of the file store (for example: `/dev/sda2`).

total.description: Total size of the file store.

total_in_bytes.description: Total size of the file store in bytes.

type.description: Type of the file store (ex: ext4).

available.description:
Total disk space available to this Java virtual machine on all file stores.
Depending on OS or process level restrictions, this might appear less than `free`.
This is the actual amount of free disk space the Opensearch node can utilise.

available_in_bytes.description:
Total number of bytes available to this Java virtual machine on all file stores.
Depending on OS or process level restrictions, this might appear less than `free_in_bytes`.
This is the actual amount of free disk space the Opensearch node can utilise.

free.description: Total unallocated disk space in all file stores.

free_in_bytes.description: Total number of unallocated bytes in all file stores.

total.description: Total size of all file stores.

total_in_bytes.description: Total size of all file stores in bytes.

devices.description:
Array of disk metrics for each device that is backing an Opensearch data path.
These disk metrics are probed periodically and averages between the last probe and the current probe are computed.

operations.description: The total number of read and write operations for the device completed since starting Opensearch.

read_kilobytes.description: The total number of kilobytes read for the device since starting Opensearch.

read_operations.description: The total number of read operations for the device completed since starting Opensearch.

write_kilobytes.description: The total number of kilobytes written for the device since starting Opensearch.

write_operations.description: The total number of write operations for the device completed since starting Opensearch.

buffer_pools.description: Contains statistics about JVM buffer pools for the node.

timestamp.description: Last time JVM statistics were refreshed.

uptime.description:
Human-readable JVM uptime.
Only returned if the `human` query parameter is `true`.

total_capacity_in_bytes.description: Total capacity of buffer pools in bytes.

used_in_bytes.description: Size of buffer pools in bytes.

current_loaded_count.description: Number of classes currently loaded by JVM.

total_loaded_count.description: Total number of classes loaded since the JVM started.

total_unloaded_count.description: Total number of classes unloaded since the JVM started.

collectors.description: Contains statistics about JVM garbage collectors for the node.

collection_count.description: Total number of JVM garbage collectors that collect objects.

collection_time.description: Total time spent by JVM collecting objects.

collection_time_in_millis.description: Total time, in milliseconds, spent by JVM collecting objects.

heap_used_in_bytes.description: Memory, in bytes, currently in use by the heap.

heap_used_percent.description: Percentage of memory currently in use by the heap.

heap_committed_in_bytes.description: Amount of memory, in bytes, available for use by the heap.

heap_max_in_bytes.description: Maximum amount of memory, in bytes, available for use by the heap.

non_heap_committed_in_bytes.description: Amount of non-heap memory available, in bytes.

pools.description: Contains statistics about heap memory usage for the node.

used_in_bytes.description: Memory, in bytes, used by the heap.

max_in_bytes.description: Maximum amount of memory, in bytes, available for use by the heap.

peak_used_in_bytes.description: Largest amount of memory, in bytes, historically used by the heap.

peak_max_in_bytes.description: Largest amount of memory, in bytes, historically used by the heap.

count.description: Number of active threads in use by JVM.

peak_count.description: Highest number of threads used by JVM.

adjusted_total_in_bytes.description:
If the amount of physical memory has been overridden using the `es`.`total_memory_bytes` system property then this reports the overridden value in bytes.
Otherwise it reports the same value as `total_in_bytes`.

total_in_bytes.description: Total amount of physical memory in bytes.

free_in_bytes.description: Amount of free physical memory in bytes.

used_in_bytes.description: Amount of used physical memory in bytes.

control_group.description: The `cpuacct` control group to which the Opensearch process belongs.
The `cpu` control group to which the Opensearch process belongs.

cfs_period_micros.description: The period of time, in microseconds, for how regularly all tasks in the same cgroup as the Opensearch process should have their access to CPU resources reallocated.

cfs_quota_micros.description: The total amount of time, in microseconds, for which all tasks in the same cgroup as the Opensearch process can run during one period `cfs_period_micros`.

number_of_elapsed_periods.description: The number of reporting periods (as specified by `cfs_period_micros`) that have elapsed.

number_of_times_throttled.description: The number of times all tasks in the same cgroup as the Opensearch process have been throttled.

control_group.description: The `memory` control group to which the Opensearch process belongs.

limit_in_bytes.description:
The maximum amount of user memory (including file cache) allowed for all tasks in the same cgroup as the Opensearch process.
This value can be too big to store in a `long`, so is returned as a string so that the value returned can exactly match what the underlying operating system interface returns.
Any value that is too large to parse into a `long` almost certainly means no limit has been set for the cgroup.

usage_in_bytes.description:
The total current memory usage by processes in the cgroup, in bytes, by all tasks in the same cgroup as the Opensearch process.
This value is stored as a string for consistency with `limit_in_bytes`.

open_file_descriptors.description: Number of opened file descriptors associated with the current or `-1` if not supported.

max_file_descriptors.description: Maximum number of file descriptors allowed on the system, or `-1` if not supported.

timestamp.description:
Last time the statistics were refreshed.
Recorded in milliseconds since the Unix Epoch.

cache_evictions.description: Total number of times the script cache has evicted old data.

compilation_limit_triggered.description: Total number of times the script compilation circuit breaker has limited inline script compilations.

compilations.description: Total number of inline script compilations performed by the node.

inbound_handling_time_histogram.description: The distribution of the time spent handling each inbound message on a transport thread, represented as a histogram.

outbound_handling_time_histogram.description: The distribution of the time spent sending each outbound transport message on a transport thread, represented as a histogram.

rx_count.description: Total number of RX (receive) packets received by the node during internal cluster communication.

rx_size.description: Size of RX packets received by the node during internal cluster communication.

rx_size_in_bytes.description: Size, in bytes, of RX packets received by the node during internal cluster communication.

server_open.description: Current number of inbound TCP connections used for internal communication between nodes.

tx_count.description: Total number of TX (transmit) packets sent by the node during internal cluster communication.

tx_size.description: Size of TX packets sent by the node during internal cluster communication.

tx_size_in_bytes.description: Size, in bytes, of TX packets sent by the node during internal cluster communication.

total_outbound_connections.description:
The cumulative number of outbound transport connections that this node has opened since it started.
Each transport connection may comprise multiple TCP connections but is only counted once in this statistic.
Transport connections are typically long-lived so this statistic should remain constant in a stable cluster.

count.description: The number of times a transport thread took a period of time within the bounds of this bucket to handle an inbound message.

lt_millis.description:
The exclusive upper bound of the bucket in milliseconds.
May be omitted on the last bucket if this bucket has no upper bound.

ge_millis.description: The inclusive lower bound of the bucket in milliseconds. May be omitted on the first bucket if this bucket has no lower bound.

cluster_state_update.description:
Contains low-level statistics about how long various activities took during cluster state updates while the node was the elected master.
Omitted if the node is not master-eligible.
Every field whose name ends in `_time` within this object is also represented as a raw number of milliseconds in a field whose name ends in `_time_millis`.
The human-readable fields with a `_time` suffix are only returned if requested with the `?human=true` query parameter.

total.description: Total number of cluster states in queue.

pending.description: Number of pending cluster states in queue.

committed.description: Number of committed cluster states in queue.

incompatible_diffs.description: Number of incompatible differences between published cluster states.

compatible_diffs.description: Number of compatible differences between published cluster states.

count.description: The number of cluster state update attempts that did not change the cluster state since the node started.

limit_in_bytes.description:
Configured memory limit, in bytes, for the indexing requests.
Replica requests have an automatic limit that is 1.5x this value.

all_in_bytes.description: Memory consumed, in bytes, by indexing requests in the coordinating, primary, or replica stage.

combined_coordinating_and_primary_in_byt.description:
Memory consumed, in bytes, by indexing requests in the coordinating or primary stage.
This value is not the sum of coordinating and primary as a node can reuse the coordinating memory if the primary stage is executed locally.

coordinating_in_bytes.description: Memory consumed, in bytes, by indexing requests in the coordinating stage.

primary_in_bytes.description: Memory consumed, in bytes, by indexing requests in the primary stage.

replica_in_bytes.description: Memory consumed, in bytes, by indexing requests in the replica stage.

coordinating_rejections.description: Number of indexing requests rejected in the coordinating stage.

primary_rejections.description: Number of indexing requests rejected in the primary stage.

replica_rejections.description: Number of indexing requests rejected in the replica stage.

rating.description: The documents relevance with regard to this search request.

ignore_unlabeled.description: Controls how unlabeled documents in the search results are counted. If set to true, unlabeled documents are ignored and neither count as relevant or irrelevant. Set to false (the default), they are treated as irrelevant.

relevant_rating_threshold.description: Sets the rating threshold above which documents are considered to be "relevant".

k.description: Sets the maximum number of documents retrieved per query. This value will act in place of the usual size parameter in the query.

normalize.description: If set to true, this metric will calculate the Normalized DCG.

maximum_relevance.description: The highest relevance grade used in the user-supplied relevance judgments.

metric_score.description: The metric_score in the details section shows the contribution of this query to the global quality metric score

unrated_docs.description: The unrated_docs section contains an _index and _id entry for each document in the search result for this query that didnt have a ratings value. This can be used to ask the user to supply ratings for these documents

hits.description: The hits section shows a grouping of the search results with their supplied ratings

metric_details.description: The metric_details give additional information about the calculated quality metric (e.g. how many of the retrieved documents were relevant). The content varies for each metric but allows for better interpretation of the results

pipeline.description: The name of the pipeline to use.

size.description:
The number of documents to index per batch.
Use when indexing from remote to ensure that the batches fit within the on-heap buffer, which defaults to a maximum size of 100 MB.

headers.description: An object containing the headers of the request.

batches.description: The number of scroll responses pulled back by the reindex.

created.description: The number of documents that were successfully created.

deleted.description: The number of documents that were successfully deleted.

noops.description: The number of documents that were ignored because the script used for the reindex returned a `noop` value for `ctx.op`.

requests_per_second.description: The number of requests per second effectively executed during the reindex.

total.description: The number of documents that were successfully processed.

updated.description: The number of documents that were successfully updated, for example, a document with same ID already existed prior to reindex updating it.

version_conflicts.description: The number of version conflicts that reindex hits.

document.description: Document thats temporarily indexed in-memory and accessible from the script.

rank_constant.description: How much influence documents in individual result sets per query have over the final ranked result set

window_size.description: Size of the individual result sets per query

deleted_blobs.description: Number of binary large objects (blobs) removed during cleanup.

deleted_bytes.description: Number of bytes freed by cleanup operations.

backing_indices.description: Total number of backing indices for the selected data streams.

data_stream_count.description: Total number of selected data streams.

data_streams.description: Contains statistics for the selected data streams.

total_store_size_bytes.description: Total size, in bytes, of all shards for the selected data streams.

metric_score.description: The overall evaluation quality calculated by the defined metric

details.description: The details section contains one entry for every query in the original requests section, keyed by the search request id

accepted.description: Equals `true` if the snapshot was accepted. Present when the request had `wait_for_completion` set to `false`

bulk#index.name: index
bulk#index.description: Name of the data stream, index, or index alias to perform bulk actions on.

bulk#pipeline.name: pipeline
bulk#pipeline.description:
ID of the pipeline to use to preprocess incoming documents.
If the index has a default ingest pipeline specified, then setting the value to `_none` disables the default ingest pipeline for this request.
If a final pipeline is configured it will always run, regardless of the value of this parameter.

bulk#refresh.name: refresh
bulk#refresh.description:
If `true`, Opensearch refreshes the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` do nothing with refreshes.
Valid values: `true`, `false`, `wait_for`.

bulk#routing.name: routing
bulk#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

bulk#_source.name: _source
bulk#_source.description: `true` or `false` to return the `_source` field or not, or a list of fields to return.

bulk#_source_excludes.name: _source_excludes
bulk#_source_excludes.description: A comma-separated list of source fields to exclude from the response.

bulk#_source_includes.name: _source_includes
bulk#_source_includes.description: A comma-separated list of source fields to include in the response.

bulk#timeout.name: timeout
bulk#timeout.description: Period each action waits for the following operations: automatic index creation, dynamic mapping updates, waiting for active shards.

bulk#wait_for_active_shards.name: wait_for_active_shards
bulk#wait_for_active_shards.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to all or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

bulk#require_alias.name: require_alias
bulk#require_alias.description: If `true`, the requests actions must target an index alias.

cat.aliases#name.name: name
cat.aliases#name.description: A comma-separated list of aliases to retrieve. Supports wildcards (`*`).  To retrieve all aliases, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

cat.aliases#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
cat.aliases#expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

cat.allocation#node_id.name: node_id
cat.allocation#node_id.description: Comma-separated list of node identifiers or names used to limit the returned information.

cat.allocation#bytes.name: bytes
cat.allocation#bytes.description: The unit used to display byte values.

cat.count#index.name: index
cat.count#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`). To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

cat.fielddata#fields.name: fields
cat.fielddata#fields.description:
Comma-separated list of fields used to limit returned information.
To retrieve all fields, omit this parameter.

cat.fielddata#bytes.name: bytes
cat.fielddata#bytes.description: The unit used to display byte values.

cat.fielddata#fields_.name: fields
cat.fielddata#fields_.description: Comma-separated list of fields used to limit returned information.

cat.indices#index.name: index
cat.indices#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`). To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

cat.indices#bytes.name: bytes
cat.indices#bytes.description: The unit used to display byte values.

cat.indices#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
cat.indices#expand_wildcards.description: The type of index that wildcard patterns can match.

cat.indices#health.name: health
cat.indices#health.description: The health status used to limit returned indices. By default, the response includes indices of any health status.

cat.indices#include_unloaded_segments.name: include_unloaded_segments
cat.indices#include_unloaded_segments.description: If true, the response includes information from segments that are not loaded into memory.

cat.indices#pri.name: pri
cat.indices#pri.description: If true, the response only includes information from primary shards.

cat.indices#time.name: time
cat.indices#time.description: The unit used to display time values.

cat.recovery#index.name: index
cat.recovery#index.description:
A comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`). To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

cat.recovery#active_only.name: active_only
cat.recovery#active_only.description: If `true`, the response only includes ongoing shard recoveries.

cat.recovery#bytes.name: bytes
cat.recovery#bytes.description: The unit used to display byte values.

cat.recovery#detailed.name: detailed
cat.recovery#detailed.description: If `true`, the response includes detailed information about shard recoveries.

cat.segments#index.name: index
cat.segments#index.description:
A comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

cat.segments#bytes.name: bytes
cat.segments#bytes.description: The unit used to display byte values.

cat.shards#index.name: index
cat.shards#index.description:
A comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

cat.shards#bytes.name: bytes
cat.shards#bytes.description: The unit used to display byte values.

cat.snapshots#repository.name: repository
cat.snapshots#repository.description:
A comma-separated list of snapshot repositories used to limit the request.
Accepts wildcard expressions.
`_all` returns all repositories.
If any repository fails during the request, Opensearch returns an error.

cat.snapshots#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
cat.snapshots#ignore_unavailable.description: If `true`, the response does not include information from unavailable snapshots.

cat.templates#name.name: name
cat.templates#name.description:
The name of the template to return.
Accepts wildcard expressions. If omitted, all templates are returned.

cat.thread_pool#thread_pool_patterns.name: thread_pool_patterns
cat.thread_pool#thread_pool_patterns.description:
A comma-separated list of thread pool names used to limit the request.
Accepts wildcard expressions.

clear_scroll#scroll_id.name: scroll_id
clear_scroll#scroll_id.description:
Comma-separated list of scroll IDs to clear.
To clear all scroll IDs, use `_all`.

cluster.allocation_explain#include_disk_.name: include_disk_info
cluster.allocation_explain#include_disk_.description: If true, returns information about disk usage and shard sizes.

cluster.allocation_explain#include_yes_d.name: include_yes_decisions
cluster.allocation_explain#include_yes_d.description: If true, returns YES decisions in explanation.

cluster.get_component_template#name.name: name
cluster.get_component_template#name.description:
Comma-separated list of component template names used to limit the request.
Wildcard (`*`) expressions are supported.

cluster.get_component_template#local.name: local
cluster.get_component_template#local.description:
If `true`, the request retrieves information from the local node only.
If `false`, information is retrieved from the master node.

cluster.get_component_template#master_ti.name: master_timeout
cluster.get_component_template#master_ti.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
cluster.get_component_template#master_ti.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

cluster.health#index.name: index
cluster.health#index.description: Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and index aliases used to limit the request. Wildcard expressions (*) are supported. To target all data streams and indices in a cluster, omit this parameter or use _all or *.

cluster.health#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
cluster.health#expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

cluster.health#level.name: level
cluster.health#level.description: Can be one of cluster, indices or shards. Controls the details level of the health information returned.

cluster.health#local.name: local
cluster.health#local.description: If true, the request retrieves information from the local node only. Defaults to false, which means information is retrieved from the master node.

cluster.health#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
cluster.health#master_timeout.description: Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
cluster.health#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

cluster.health#timeout.name: timeout
cluster.health#timeout.description: Period to wait for a response. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

cluster.health#wait_for_active_shards.name: wait_for_active_shards
cluster.health#wait_for_active_shards.description: A number controlling to how many active shards to wait for, all to wait for all shards in the cluster to be active, or 0 to not wait.

cluster.health#wait_for_events.name: wait_for_events
cluster.health#wait_for_events.description: Can be one of immediate, urgent, high, normal, low, languid. Wait until all currently queued events with the given priority are processed.

cluster.health#wait_for_nodes.name: wait_for_nodes
cluster.health#wait_for_nodes.description: The request waits until the specified number N of nodes is available. It also accepts >=N, <=N, >N and <N. Alternatively, it is possible to use ge(N), le(N), gt(N) and lt(N) notation.

cluster.health#wait_for_no_initializing_.name: wait_for_no_initializing_shards
cluster.health#wait_for_no_initializing_.description: A boolean value which controls whether to wait (until the timeout provided) for the cluster to have no shard initializations. Defaults to false, which means it will not wait for initializing shards.

cluster.health#wait_for_no_relocating_sh.name: wait_for_no_relocating_shards
cluster.health#wait_for_no_relocating_sh.description: A boolean value which controls whether to wait (until the timeout provided) for the cluster to have no shard relocations. Defaults to false, which means it will not wait for relocating shards.

cluster.health#wait_for_status.name: wait_for_status
cluster.health#wait_for_status.description: One of green, yellow or red. Will wait (until the timeout provided) until the status of the cluster changes to the one provided or better, i.e. green > yellow > red. By default, will not wait for any status.

cluster.put_component_template#name.name: name
cluster.put_component_template#name.description:
Name of the component template to create.
Opensearch includes the following built-in component templates: `logs-mappings`; 'logs-settings`; `metrics-mappings`; `metrics-settings`;`synthetics-mapping`; `synthetics-settings`.
Opensearch Agent uses these templates to configure backing indices for its data streams.
If you use Opensearch Agent and want to overwrite one of these templates, set the `version` for your replacement template higher than the current version.
If you dont use Opensearch Agent and want to disable all built-in component and index templates, set `stack.templates.enabled` to `false` using the cluster update settings API.

cluster.put_component_template#create.name: create
cluster.put_component_template#create.description: If `true`, this request cannot replace or update existing component templates.

cluster.put_component_template#master_ti.name: master_timeout
cluster.put_component_template#master_ti.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
cluster.put_component_template#master_ti.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

cluster.state#metric.name: metric
cluster.state#metric.description: Limit the information returned to the specified metrics

cluster.state#index.name: index
cluster.state#index.description: A comma-separated list of index names; use `_all` or empty string to perform the operation on all indices

cluster.state#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
cluster.state#allow_no_indices.description: Whether to ignore if a wildcard indices expression resolves into no concrete indices. (This includes `_all` string or when no indices have been specified)

cluster.state#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
cluster.state#expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

cluster.state#flat_settings.name: flat_settings
cluster.state#flat_settings.description: Return settings in flat format (default: false)

cluster.state#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
cluster.state#ignore_unavailable.description: Whether specified concrete indices should be ignored when unavailable (missing or closed)

cluster.state#local.name: local
cluster.state#local.description: Return local information, do not retrieve the state from master node (default: false)

cluster.state#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
cluster.state#master_timeout.description: Specify timeout for connection to master
cluster.state#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

cluster.state#wait_for_metadata_version.name: wait_for_metadata_version
cluster.state#wait_for_metadata_version.description: Wait for the metadata version to be equal or greater than the specified metadata version

cluster.state#wait_for_timeout.name: wait_for_timeout
cluster.state#wait_for_timeout.description: The maximum time to wait for wait_for_metadata_version before timing out

cluster.stats#node_id.name: node_id
cluster.stats#node_id.description: Comma-separated list of node filters used to limit returned information. Defaults to all nodes in the cluster.

cluster.stats#flat_settings.name: flat_settings
cluster.stats#flat_settings.description: If `true`, returns settings in flat format.

cluster.stats#timeout.name: timeout
cluster.stats#timeout.description:
Period to wait for each node to respond.
If a node does not respond before its timeout expires, the response does not include its stats.
However, timed out nodes are included in the responses `_nodes.failed` property. Defaults to no timeout.

count#index.name: index
count#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To search all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

Context in which the script or search template should run.
To prevent errors, the API immediately compiles the script or template in this context.

put_script#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
put_script#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
put_script#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

put_script#timeout.name: timeout
put_script#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

rank_eval#index.name: index
rank_eval#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and index aliases used to limit the request. Wildcard (`*`) expressions are supported.
To target all data streams and indices in a cluster, omit this parameter or use `_all` or `*`.

rank_eval#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
rank_eval#allow_no_indices.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices. This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices. For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

rank_eval#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
rank_eval#expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

rank_eval#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
rank_eval#ignore_unavailable.description: If `true`, missing or closed indices are not included in the response.

render_search_template#id.name: id
render_search_template#id.description:
ID of the search template to render.
If no `source` is specified, this or the `id` request body parameter is required.

scroll#scroll.name: scroll
scroll#scroll.description: Period to retain the search context for scrolling.

scroll#scroll_id_.name: scroll_id
scroll#scroll_id_.description: The scroll ID for scrolled search

scroll#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
scroll#rest_total_hits_as_int.description: If true, the API responses hit.total property is returned as an integer. If false, the API responses hit.total property is returned as an object.

search#index.name: index
search#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To search all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

search#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
search#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.
For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

search#allow_partial_search_results.name: allow_partial_search_results
search#allow_partial_search_results.description: If true, returns partial results if there are shard request timeouts or shard failures. If false, returns an error with no partial results.

search#analyzer.name: analyzer
search#analyzer.description:
Analyzer to use for the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the q query string parameter is specified.

search#analyze_wildcard.name: analyze_wildcard
search#analyze_wildcard.description:
If true, wildcard and prefix queries are analyzed.
This parameter can only be used when the q query string parameter is specified.

search#batched_reduce_size.name: batched_reduce_size
search#batched_reduce_size.description:
The number of shard results that should be reduced at once on the coordinating node.
This value should be used as a protection mechanism to reduce the memory overhead per search request if the potential number of shards in the request can be large.

search#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
search#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If true, network round-trips between the coordinating node and the remote clusters are minimized when executing cross-cluster search (CCS) requests.

search#default_operator.name: default_operator
search#default_operator.description:
The default operator for query string query: AND or OR.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

search#df.name: df
search#df.description:
Field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the q query string parameter is specified.

search#docvalue_fields.name: docvalue_fields
search#docvalue_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return as the docvalue representation for each hit.

search#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
search#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.

search#explain.name: explain
search#explain.description: If `true`, returns detailed information about score computation as part of a hit.

search#ignore_throttled.name: ignore_throttled
search#ignore_throttled.description: If `true`, concrete, expanded or aliased indices will be ignored when frozen.

search#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
search#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

search#lenient.name: lenient
search#lenient.description:
If `true`, format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) in the query string will be ignored.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

search#max_concurrent_shard_requests.name: max_concurrent_shard_requests
search#max_concurrent_shard_requests.description:
Defines the number of concurrent shard requests per node this search executes concurrently.
This value should be used to limit the impact of the search on the cluster in order to limit the number of concurrent shard requests.

search#preference.name: preference

search#pre_filter_shard_size.name: pre_filter_shard_size

search#request_cache.name: request_cache
search#request_cache.description:
If `true`, the caching of search results is enabled for requests where `size` is `0`.
Defaults to index level settings.

search#routing.name: routing
search#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

search#scroll.name: scroll
search#scroll.description:
Period to retain the search context for scrolling. See Scroll search results.
By default, this value cannot exceed `1d` (24 hours).
You can change this limit using the `search.max_keep_alive` cluster-level setting.

search#search_type.name: search_type
search#search_type.description: How distributed term frequencies are calculated for relevance scoring.

search#stats.name: stats
search#stats.description: Specific `tag` of the request for logging and statistical purposes.

search#stored_fields.name: stored_fields
search#stored_fields.description:
A comma-separated list of stored fields to return as part of a hit.
If no fields are specified, no stored fields are included in the response.
If this field is specified, the `_source` parameter defaults to `false`.
You can pass `_source: true` to return both source fields and stored fields in the search response.

search#suggest_field.name: suggest_field
search#suggest_field.description: Specifies which field to use for suggestions.

search#suggest_mode.name: suggest_mode
search#suggest_mode.description:
Specifies the suggest mode.
This parameter can only be used when the `suggest_field` and `suggest_text` query string parameters are specified.

search#suggest_size.name: suggest_size
search#suggest_size.description:
Number of suggestions to return.
This parameter can only be used when the `suggest_field` and `suggest_text` query string parameters are specified.

search#suggest_text.name: suggest_text
search#suggest_text.description:
The source text for which the suggestions should be returned.
This parameter can only be used when the `suggest_field` and `suggest_text` query string parameters are specified.

search#terminate_after.name: terminate_after
search#terminate_after.description:
Maximum number of documents to collect for each shard.
If a query reaches this limit, Opensearch terminates the query early.
Opensearch collects documents before sorting.
Use with caution.
Opensearch applies this parameter to each shard handling the request.
When possible, let Opensearch perform early termination automatically.
Avoid specifying this parameter for requests that target data streams with backing indices across multiple data tiers.
If set to `0` (default), the query does not terminate early.

search#timeout.name: timeout
search#timeout.description:
Specifies the period of time to wait for a response from each shard.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

search#track_total_hits.name: track_total_hits
search#track_total_hits.description:
Number of hits matching the query to count accurately.
If `true`, the exact number of hits is returned at the cost of some performance.
If `false`, the response does not include the total number of hits matching the query.

search#track_scores.name: track_scores
search#track_scores.description: If `true`, calculate and return document scores, even if the scores are not used for sorting.

search#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
search#typed_keys.description: If `true`, aggregation and suggester names are be prefixed by their respective types in the response.

search#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
search#rest_total_hits_as_int.description: Indicates whether `hits.total` should be rendered as an integer or an object in the rest search response.

search#version.name: version
search#version.description: If `true`, returns document version as part of a hit.

search#_source.name: _source

search#_source_excludes.name: _source_excludes
search#_source_excludes.description:
A comma-separated list of source fields to exclude from the response.
You can also use this parameter to exclude fields from the subset specified in `_source_includes` query parameter.
If the `_source` parameter is `false`, this parameter is ignored.

search#_source_includes.name: _source_includes
search#_source_includes.description:
A comma-separated list of source fields to include in the response.
If this parameter is specified, only these source fields are returned.
You can exclude fields from this subset using the `_source_excludes` query parameter.
If the `_source` parameter is `false`, this parameter is ignored.

search#seq_no_primary_term.name: seq_no_primary_term
search#seq_no_primary_term.description: If `true`, returns sequence number and primary term of the last modification of each hit.

search#q.name: q
search#q.description:
Query in the Lucene query string syntax using query parameter search.
Query parameter searches do not support the full Opensearch Query DSL but are handy for testing.

search#size.name: size
search#size.description:
Defines the number of hits to return.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the `from` and `size` parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

search#from.name: from
search#from.description:
Starting document offset.
Needs to be non-negative.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the `from` and `size` parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

search_shards#index.name: index
search_shards#index.description: Returns the indices and shards that a search request would be executed against.

search_shards#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
search_shards#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.
For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

search_shards#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
search_shards#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

search_shards#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
search_shards#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

search_shards#local.name: local
search_shards#local.description: If `true`, the request retrieves information from the local node only.

search_shards#preference.name: preference
search_shards#preference.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

search_shards#routing.name: routing
search_shards#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

search_template#index.name: index
search_template#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices,
and aliases to search. Supports wildcards (*).

search_template#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
search_template#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.
For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

search_template#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
search_template#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If `true`, network round-trips are minimized for cross-cluster search requests.

search_template#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
search_template#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

search_template#explain.name: explain
search_template#explain.description: If `true`, the response includes additional details about score computation as part of a hit.

search_template#ignore_throttled.name: ignore_throttled
search_template#ignore_throttled.description: If `true`, specified concrete, expanded, or aliased indices are not included in the response when throttled.

search_template#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
search_template#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

search_template#preference.name: preference
search_template#preference.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

search_template#profile.name: profile
search_template#profile.description: If `true`, the query execution is profiled.

search_template#routing.name: routing
search_template#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

search_template#scroll.name: scroll
search_template#scroll.description:
Specifies how long a consistent view of the index
should be maintained for scrolled search.

search_template#search_type.name: search_type
search_template#search_type.description: The type of the search operation.

search_template#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
search_template#rest_total_hits_as_int.description: If true, hits.total are rendered as an integer in the response.

search_template#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
search_template#typed_keys.description: If `true`, the response prefixes aggregation and suggester names with their respective types.

snapshot.create#snapshot.name: snapshot
snapshot.create#snapshot.description: Name of the snapshot. Must be unique in the repository.

snapshot.create#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
snapshot.create#master_timeout.description: Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
snapshot.create#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

snapshot.create#wait_for_completion.name: wait_for_completion
snapshot.create#wait_for_completion.description: If `true`, the request returns a response when the snapshot is complete. If `false`, the request returns a response when the snapshot initializes.

snapshot.create_repository#master_timeou.name: master_timeout
snapshot.create_repository#master_timeou.description: Explicit operation timeout for connection to master node
snapshot.create_repository#master_timeou.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

snapshot.create_repository#verify.name: verify
snapshot.create_repository#verify.description: Whether to verify the repository after creation

snapshot.get_repository#repository.name: repository
snapshot.get_repository#repository.description: A comma-separated list of repository names

snapshot.get_repository#local.name: local
snapshot.get_repository#local.description: Return local information, do not retrieve the state from master node (default: false)

snapshot.get_repository#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
snapshot.get_repository#master_timeout.description: Explicit operation timeout for connection to master node
snapshot.get_repository#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

snapshot.status#snapshot.name: snapshot
snapshot.status#snapshot.description: A comma-separated list of snapshot names

snapshot.status#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
snapshot.status#ignore_unavailable.description: Whether to ignore unavailable snapshots, defaults to false which means a SnapshotMissingException is thrown

snapshot.status#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
snapshot.status#master_timeout.description: Explicit operation timeout for connection to master node
snapshot.status#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

tasks.cancel#actions.name: actions
tasks.cancel#actions.description: Comma-separated list or wildcard expression of actions used to limit the request.

tasks.cancel#nodes.name: nodes
tasks.cancel#nodes.description: Comma-separated list of node IDs or names used to limit the request.

tasks.cancel#parent_task_id.name: parent_task_id
tasks.cancel#parent_task_id.description: Parent task ID used to limit the tasks.

tasks.cancel#wait_for_completion.name: wait_for_completion
tasks.cancel#wait_for_completion.description: Should the request block until the cancellation of the task and its descendant tasks is completed. Defaults to false

termvectors#index.name: index
termvectors#index.description: Name of the index that contains the document.

termvectors#fields.name: fields
termvectors#fields.description:
Comma-separated list or wildcard expressions of fields to include in the statistics.
Used as the default list unless a specific field list is provided in the `completion_fields` or `fielddata_fields` parameters.

termvectors#field_statistics.name: field_statistics
termvectors#field_statistics.description: If `true`, the response includes the document count, sum of document frequencies, and sum of total term frequencies.

termvectors#offsets.name: offsets
termvectors#offsets.description: If `true`, the response includes term offsets.

termvectors#payloads.name: payloads
termvectors#payloads.description: If `true`, the response includes term payloads.

termvectors#positions.name: positions
termvectors#positions.description: If `true`, the response includes term positions.

termvectors#preference.name: preference
termvectors#preference.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

termvectors#realtime.name: realtime
termvectors#realtime.description: If true, the request is real-time as opposed to near-real-time.

termvectors#routing.name: routing
termvectors#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

termvectors#term_statistics.name: term_statistics
termvectors#term_statistics.description: If `true`, the response includes term frequency and document frequency.

termvectors#version.name: version
termvectors#version.description: If `true`, returns the document version as part of a hit.

schema.description: The operation definition and data (action-data pairs), separated by newlines
Comma-separated list of scroll IDs to clear if none was specified via the scroll_id parameter

current_node.description: Specifies the node ID or the name of the node to only explain a shard that is currently located on the specified node.

primary.description: If true, returns explanation for the primary shard for the given shard ID.

shard.description: Specifies the ID of the shard that you would like an explanation for.

schema.description: The index, shard, and primary flag to explain. Empty means 'explain the first unassigned shard'

allow_auto_create.description:
This setting overrides the value of the `action.auto_create_index` cluster setting.
If set to `true` in a template, then indices can be automatically created using that
template even if auto-creation of indices is disabled via `actions.auto_create_index`.
If set to `false` then data streams matching the template must always be explicitly created.

The document

analyzer.description:
The name of the analyzer that should be applied to the provided `text`.
This could be a built-in analyzer, or an analyzer thats been configured in the index.

attributes.description: Array of token attributes used to filter the output of the `explain` parameter.

char_filter.description: Array of character filters used to preprocess characters before the tokenizer.

explain.description: If `true`, the response includes token attributes and additional details.

filter.description: Array of token filters used to apply after the tokenizer.

normalizer.description: Normalizer to use to convert text into a single token.

schema.description: Define analyzer/tokenizer parameters and the text on which the analysis should be performed

settings.description: Configuration options for the target index.

schema.description: The configuration for the target index (`settings` and `aliases`)

is_write_index.description:
If `true`, sets the write index or data stream for the alias.
If an alias points to multiple indices or data streams and `is_write_index` isnt set, the alias rejects write requests.
If an index alias points to one index and `is_write_index` isnt set, the index automatically acts as the write index.
Data stream aliases dont automatically set a write data stream, even if the alias points to one data stream.

schema.description: The settings for the alias, such as `routing` or `filter`

composed_of.description:
An ordered list of component template names.
Component templates are merged in the order specified, meaning that the last component template specified has the highest precedence.

priority.description:
Priority to determine index template precedence when a new data stream or index is created.
The index template with the highest priority is chosen.
If no priority is specified the template is treated as though it is of priority 0 (lowest priority).
This number is not automatically generated by Opensearch.

schema.description: The template definition

date_detection.description: Controls whether dynamic date detection is enabled.

dynamic_date_formats.description:
If date detection is enabled then new string fields are checked
against 'dynamic_date_formats' and if the value matches then
a new date field is added instead of string.

dynamic_templates.description: Specify dynamic templates for the mapping.

numeric_detection.description: Automatically map strings into numeric data types for all fields.

properties.description:
Mapping for a field. For new fields, this mapping can include:

- Field name
- Field data type
- Mapping parameters

schema.description: The mapping definition

index_patterns.description:
Array of wildcard expressions used to match the names
of indices during creation.

order.description:
Order in which Opensearch applies this template if index
matches multiple templates.

Templates with lower 'order' values are merged first. Templates with higher
'order' values are merged later, overriding templates with lower values.

schema.description: The template definition

aliases.description:
Aliases for the target index.
Data streams do not support this parameter.

settings.description:
Configuration options for the index.
Data streams do not support this parameter.

aliases.description:
The key is the alias name.
Index alias names support date math.

settings.description: Configuration options for the target index.

The request definitions (metadata-search request definition pairs), separated by newlines
The request definitions (metadata-search request definition pairs), separated by newlines

ids.description: Simplified syntax to specify documents by their ID if they're in the same index.

An object containing the password for the opensearch keystore
The document

Key-value pairs used to replace Mustache variables in the template.

An inline search template.
Supports the same parameters as the search API's request body.
These parameters also support Mustache variables.
If no `id` or `<templated-id>` is specified, this parameter is required.

context.description: The context that the script should run in.

The scroll ID if not passed by URL or query parameter.

aggregations.description: Defines the aggregations that are run as part of the search request.

explain.description: If true, returns detailed information about score computation as part of a hit.

ext.description: Configuration of search extensions defined by Opensearch plugins.

from.description:
Starting document offset.
Needs to be non-negative.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the `from` and `size` parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

indices_boost.description: Boosts the _score of documents from specified indices.

docvalue_fields.description:
Array of wildcard (`*`) patterns.
The request returns doc values for field names matching these patterns in the `hits.fields` property of the response.

knn.description: Defines the approximate kNN search to run.

min_score.description:
Minimum `_score` for matching documents.
Documents with a lower `_score` are not included in the search results.

profile.description:
Set to `true` to return detailed timing information about the execution of individual components in a search request.
NOTE: This is a debugging tool and adds significant overhead to search execution.

rescore.description: Can be used to improve precision by reordering just the top (for example 100 - 500) documents returned by the `query` and `post_filter` phases.

script_fields.description: Retrieve a script evaluation (based on different fields) for each hit.

size.description:
The number of hits to return.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the `from` and `size` parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

fields.description:
Array of wildcard (`*`) patterns.
The request returns values for field names matching these patterns in the `hits.fields` property of the response.

terminate_after.description:
Maximum number of documents to collect for each shard.
If a query reaches this limit, Opensearch terminates the query early.
Opensearch collects documents before sorting.
Use with caution.
Opensearch applies this parameter to each shard handling the request.
When possible, let Opensearch perform early termination automatically.
Avoid specifying this parameter for requests that target data streams with backing indices across multiple data tiers.
If set to `0` (default), the query does not terminate early.

timeout.description:
Specifies the period of time to wait for a response from each shard.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
Defaults to no timeout.

track_scores.description: If true, calculate and return document scores, even if the scores are not used for sorting.

version.description: If true, returns document version as part of a hit.

seq_no_primary_term.description: If `true`, returns sequence number and primary term of the last modification of each hit.

stats.description:
Stats groups to associate with the search.
Each group maintains a statistics aggregation for its associated searches.
You can retrieve these stats using the indices stats API.

schema.description: The search definition using the Query DSL

explain.description: If `true`, returns detailed information about score calculation as part of each hit.

params.description:
Key-value pairs used to replace Mustache variables in the template.
The key is the variable name.
The value is the variable value.

profile.description: If `true`, the query execution is profiled.

source.description:
An inline search template. Supports the same parameters as the search API's
request body. Also supports Mustache variables. If no id is specified, this
parameter is required.

schema.description: The search definition template and its params

ignore_unavailable.description: If `true`, the request ignores data streams and indices in `indices` that are missing or closed. If `false`, the request returns an error for any data stream or index that is missing or closed.

include_global_state.description: If `true`, the current cluster state is included in the snapshot. The cluster state includes persistent cluster settings, composable index templates, legacy index templates, ingest pipelines, and ILM policies. It also includes data stored in system indices, such as Watches and task records (configurable via `feature_states`).

feature_states.description: Feature states to include in the snapshot. Each feature state includes one or more system indices containing related data. You can view a list of eligible features using the get features API. If `include_global_state` is `true`, all current feature states are included by default. If `include_global_state` is `false`, no feature states are included by default.

partial.description: If `true`, allows restoring a partial snapshot of indices with unavailable shards. Only shards that were successfully included in the snapshot will be restored. All missing shards will be recreated as empty. If `false`, the entire restore operation will fail if one or more indices included in the snapshot do not have all primary shards available.

doc.description: An artificial document (a document not present in the index) for which you want to retrieve term vectors.
